Function.description: The initial situation
Function.friendlyDescription:
You could:
  • introduce the main characters, and
  • introduce the time, and
  • introduce the place, and
  • introduce the situation.

Function.description: The absence of a character or characters (the absent guardian(s)) is created
Function.friendlyDescription:
For example:
  • grown-ups leave children alone, or
  • children go away on their own.

Function.description: An interdiction or injunction is given
Function.friendlyDescription:
Someone is given a warning.

  • They are told they must do something, or
  • they are told they must not do something.

Function.description: An interdiction is violated or an injunction fulfilled
Function.friendlyDescription:
Someone ignores a warning.

  • They do not do what they were told, or
  • they do what they were told not to.

Function.description: An attempt to obtain information is made
Function.friendlyDescription:
Someone tries to get information.

    For example:
  • The VILLAIN spies on a person he wants to get, or
  • the VILLAIN asks questions about something he wants to steal, or
  • the HERO asks questions about the VILLAIN.

Function.description: Information is delivered
Function.friendlyDescription:
Someone gets some information.

    For example:
  • The VILLAIN learns something about a person he wants to get, or
  • the VILLAIN learns something about something he wants to steal, or
  • the HERO learns something about the VILLAIN.

Function.description: The villain attempts to deceive or coerce the victim
Function.friendlyDescription: The VILLAIN tries to trick someone into doing something they shouldn't.

Function.description: The victim submits to deception or coercion
Function.friendlyDescription: Someone falls for the VILLAIN's trick and does something they shouldn't.

Function.description: The villain creates a misfortune or crisis
Function.friendlyDescription:
The villain does something bad.

  • the villain steals something, or
  • the villain kidnaps someone, or
  • the villain damages something, or
  • the villain hurts someone, or
  • the villain makes someone leave home.

Function.description: Something is lacking or desired
Function.friendlyDescription:
Someone wants something they don't have.

  • a friend, or
  • something magical, or
  • something nice, or
  • money, or
  • food, or
  • something else.

Function.description: The misfortune or shortage is made known to the hero
Function.friendlyDescription:
The hero learns about the villainy.

For example:

  • someone calls for help, or
  • someone tells the hero about it, or
  • someone asks the hero to help, or
  • some other way.

Function.description: The seeker hero agrees to or decides upon counteraction
Function.friendlyDescription: The HERO decides to go on a journey to put right the villainy.

Function.description: The hero leaves home
Function.friendlyDescription: The HERO leaves on a journey to put right the villainy.

Function.description: The donor presents a test to the hero
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO meets a magical HELPER (person or animal) who gives the hero a test.

  • They ask the hero a question, or
  • they ask the hero for help, or
  • they fight the hero, or
  • they make the hero an offer, or
  • something else.

Function.description: The hero reacts to the donor
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO answers the test.

  • They answer the question correctly or incorrectly, or
  • they help or do not help, or
  • they win or lose the fight, or
  • they accept or refuse the offer, or
  • something else.

Function.description: The hero receives the magical agent
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO gets something special.

For example:

  • The helper gives the hero something magic, or
  • the helper tells the hero where to get something useful, or
  • the hero steals something special from the helper.

Function.description: The hero arrives at the whereabouts of the object of search.
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO gets to the destination of their journey.

They might get there by:

  • travelling on an animal, or
  • travelling on something magic, or
  • following someone, or
  • finding a special doorway.

Function.description: A struggle begins between the hero and the villain
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO and the VILLAIN begin a competition...

  • they start to fight each other, or
  • they start a game against each other.

Function.description:
• they lose the fight, or
  • they lose the game, or
  • they get scared off, or
  • they get killed.
Function.friendlyDescription:
• They lose the fight, or
  • they lose the game, or
  • they get scared off, or
  • they get killed.

Function.description: The misfortune or lack is liquidated
Function.friendlyDescription:
For example:

  • The thing that was stolen returns, or
  • the person that was kidnapped returns, or
  • someone gets the thing that they want.

Function.description: The hero sets out to return
Function.friendlyDescription: The HERO starts to go back home.

Function.description: A pursuit of the hero begins
Function.friendlyDescription: The VILLAIN chases the HERO.

Function.description: The hero is rescued from or escapes pursuit
Function.friendlyDescription: The HERO escapes from the VILLAIN

Function.description: The false hero or villain is punished
Function.friendlyDescription:
The VILLAIN is punished, or
the VILLAIN is forgiven.

Function.description: The hero is rewarded
Function.friendlyDescription:
The HERO gets a reward...

  • they get married, or
  • they get a new home, or
  • they get money or nice things, or
  • something else.
